level.text: Hearings shall be recorded and transcribed under the direction of the Board.
Whenever a proceeding is transcribed, the Board shall notify all parties (or their representatives) by telephone that the transcript is available for purchase directly from the transcription company.
Changes in the official transcript may be made only in cases of material error.

A motion to correct the transcript shall be filed with the Board within ten (10) calendar days of the date the transcript is available to the movant. Copies of the motion shall be served on all parties.
If no objections to the motion are filed within five (5) days after service of the motion, the Board may correct the transcript.
The Board shall have final authority to dispose of all motions for correction of the record.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 51 DCR 4309 (April 30, 2004); as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 55 DCR 12991 (December 26, 2008).
